abstract: New York City Education Dept announces that student suspensions at public schools fell almost 32 percent from July to December in 2015, in comparison with same period year earlier; de Blasio administration has focused on school-discipline reform in effort to keep students in school.
lead_paragraph: The use of the punishment declined by 32 percent during the second half of 2015, in part because of curtailed suspensions for defying authority.

headline.main: Suspensions Keep Falling in New York City’s Schools
